member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Products.SyntaxEditor.SR
member.summary: Provides access to the string resources of this assembly, also allowing for their customization.
member.remarks:
Call the method to return a resolved resource string. If a custom string has been set for a specified string resource name, it will be returned. Otherwise, the default string resource value is returned.
If any of the resource strings are customized via a call to , it is best to do so before any other classes in this assembly are referenced, such as in the application startup.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory
member.summary: Provides access to the built-in instances, that export text to other formats such as HTML or RTF markup.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateHtmlClassBased
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to HTML, using CSS classes for syntax highlighting.
member.returns: An that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: CSS class references will be used for highlighting. This type adds a STYLE tag block to the exported HTML where CSS classes are defined. The text in the code block references these CSS classes, therefore allowing color settings to easily be altered for each highlighting style (i.e. keywords, comments, etc.). Root HTML, BODY and other tags will be added to the output.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateHtmlClipboard
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to HTML, in a format that is compatible with the Windows clipboard HTML data format.
member.returns: An that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: The output of this exporter is the same as , except that some additional information is added to make the exported text compatible with the Windows clipboard HTML data format.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateHtmlInline
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to HTML, using inline CSS for syntax highlighting.
member.returns: An that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: Inline CSS styles will be used for highlighting. This type allows for the code block to be directly copied out of the exported document and pasted into another. Root HTML, BODY and other tags will be added to the output.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateHtmlInlineFragment
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to HTML, using inline CSS for syntax highlighting and no root HTML or BODY tags.
member.returns: An that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: Inline CSS styles will be used for highlighting. This type allows for the code block to be directly copied out of the exported document and pasted into another. Root HTML, BODY and other tags will not be added to the output.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporterFactory.CreateRtf
member.summary: Returns an that can export text to RTF.
member.returns: An that can export text to RTF.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IndentMode
member.summary: Specifies the type of indentation to perform when the key is pressed.
member.remarks: If the syntax language does not have a service registered, the default indent mode is to Block indent.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IndentMode.None
member.summary: When selected, no automatic indenting occurs when the end user presses Enter to move to a new line of text, and the cursor is placed at the first column of the next line.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IndentMode.Block
member.summary: When selected and the end user presses Enter, the new line of text is automatically indented to the same indentation as the line preceding it.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IndentMode.Smart
member.summary: When selected and the end user presses Enter, the new line of text is automatically indented based on what the current language's service determines the context to be.

member.summary: Provides access to the built-in instances, that export text to other formats such as HTML or RTF markup.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporters.HtmlClassBased
member.summary: Gets the that can export text to HTML, using CSS classes for syntax highlighting.
member.value: The that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: CSS class references will be used for highlighting. This type adds a STYLE tag block to the exported HTML where CSS classes are defined. The text in the code block references these CSS classes, therefore allowing color settings to easily be altered for each highlighting style (i.e. keywords, comments, etc.). Root HTML, BODY and other tags will be added to the output.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporters.HtmlClipboard
member.summary: Gets the that can export text to HTML, in a format that is compatible with the Windows clipboard HTML data format.
member.value: The that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: The output of this exporter is the same as , except that some additional information is added to make the exported text compatible with the Windows clipboard HTML data format.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporters.HtmlInline
member.summary: Gets the that can export text to HTML, using inline CSS for syntax highlighting.
member.value: The that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: Inline CSS styles will be used for highlighting. This type allows for the code block to be directly copied out of the exported document and pasted into another. Root HTML, BODY and other tags will be added to the output.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Text.Exporters.TextExporters.HtmlInlineFragment
member.summary: Gets the that can export text to HTML, using inline CSS for syntax highlighting and no root HTML or BODY tags.
member.value: The that can export text to HTML.
member.remarks: Inline CSS styles will be used for highlighting. This type allows for the code block to be directly copied out of the exported document and pasted into another. Root HTML, BODY and other tags will not be added to the output.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IHitTestResult.Offset
member.summary: Gets the zero-based offset within the that is directly under the , or closest to it.
member.value: The zero-based offset within the that is directly under the , or closest to it.
member.remarks:
If the is directly over a character, the property returns HitTestResultType.ViewTextAreaOverCharacter and this property indicates the offset of the character. Otherwise, the offset of the nearest character is used. For instance, locations over the line number margin will return the offset of the first character in the view line that the mouse is over.
The value will be -1 if the is not over an editor view.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IHitTestResult.Position
member.summary: Gets the zero-based within the that is directly under the , or closest to it.
member.value: The zero-based within the that is directly under the , or closest to it.
member.remarks:
If the is directly over a character, the property returns HitTestResultType.ViewTextAreaOverCharacter and this property indicates the of the character. Otherwise, the position of the nearest character is used. For instance, locations over the line number margin will return the position of the first character in the view line that the mouse is over.
The value will be TextPosition.Empty if the is not over an editor view.

Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.IntelliPrompt.ICompletionSession.AllowedCharacters
member.summary: Gets the containing the non-letter/digit characters allowed to be typed while the completion popup is displayed.
member.value: The containing the non-letter/digit characters allowed to be typed while the completion popup is displayed.
member.remarks:
All letter and digit characters are automatically allowed by the completion popup and therefore do not need to added to this property. This property should only contain additional non-letter/digit characters that need to be allowed.
When a character is typed, it's first checked to see if it's a letter, number, or is in the collection. If any of those cases is true, the character is entered into the editor and the session remains open. member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.EditActions.MacroAction.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.IsDocumentReadOnly
member.summary: Gets whether the attached document is read-only.
member.value: true if attached document is read-only; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Use the . property to alter this value.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.IsTextDataBindingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether data binding on the property is currently enabled.
member.value: true if data binding on the property is currently enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: Data binding is off by default on the property for two reasons. First, supporting the dependency property means that two full copies of the document text are stored in memory instead of one, which can increase memory a lot for large documents. Second, the full text must be set to the dependency property after each text change, meaning performance could suffer depending on the size of the document.
It is recommended to only set to true when data binding is required, and note that the property must be set before creating a binding on the property.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the complete document text within the editor. This property is created specifically for data binding, and be sure to see the remarks for important configuration and performance information.
member.value: The complete document text within the editor.

remarks.para: Every time the getter of this property is called, the text of the document is reconstructed. Every call to the setter, sets the complete document text. Therefore many calls to this property can be a performance bottleneck.

Data binding is off by default on the property for two reasons. First, supporting the dependency property means that two full copies of the document text are stored in memory instead of one, which can increase memory a lot for large documents. Second, the full text must be set to the dependency property after each text change, meaning performance could suffer depending on the size of the document.

Data binding can be enabled by setting the property to true. It is recommended to only set to true when data binding is required, and note that the property must be set before creating a binding on the property.
When is false, the dependency property is not used and text is get/set directly from the document.
To properly get text substrings from the document, get the current from . and use the method. Likewise, to determine document length, use the . property.
Programmatic document updates should be performed using methods on .

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CanCutCopyBlankLineWhenNoSelection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether cut/copy operations on a blank line with no selection overwrites the clipboard with the blank line.
member.value: true if cut/copy operations on a blank line with no selection overwrites the clipboard with the blank line; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When there is no selection in the editor and a cut or copy operation occurs, the text of the current line will be sent to the clipboard. If the text is subsequently pasted back into the editor while there is no selection, a new link will be created to insert the clipboard data and the caret will not move. Even if this property is false, cutting of blank lines will occur but the clipboard will not be changed.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CanCutCopyDragWithHtml
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the cutting and copying of text to the clipboard or dragging text also copies the text in HTML format, which retains syntax highlighting.
member.value: true if HTML format is included; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Activating this feature will cause a slight delay when cutting, copying, or dragging text since the building of HTML formatted text can take time. However most likely this delay will be negligible.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.CanCutCopyDragWithRtf

member.value: true if RTF format is included; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Activating this feature will cause a slight delay when cutting, copying, or dragging text since the building of RTF formatted text can take time. However most likely this delay will be negligible.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.IsMouseWheelZoomEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether holding Ctrl while scrolling the mouse wheel allows view zooming.
member.value: true if the mouse wheel zooming is enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Mouse wheel zooming occurs at 0.25 (25%) increments so plan your and settings in increments of 0.25 for best results.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.IsMultiLine
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the editor allows multiple lines of text.
member.value: true if the editor allows multiple lines of text; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When this property is false, only a single line of text is permitted in the document and the editor renders like a native WPF single-line textbox.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.IsOverwriteModeActive
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the editor is in overwrite mode, where typing overwrites the character at the caret's offset.
member.value: true if the editor is in overwrite mode; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.IsWordWrapEnabled
member.summary: Gets whether word wrap mode is currently enabled.
member.value: true if word wrap mode is currently enabled; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Set the property to control to designate the current word wrap mode.

member.value: An enumerator for logical child elements of this element.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.MaxIntelliPromptZoomLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a percentage value indicating the maximum zoom level of IntelliPrompt content when the property is changed.
member.value: A percentage value indicating the maximum zoom level of IntelliPrompt content when the property is changed. The default value is 3.0, meaning 300%.
member.remarks: Set the property to true to allow end user zooming when Ctrl is held and the mouse wheel is turned.

member.remarks: Set the property to true to allow end user zooming when Ctrl is held and the mouse wheel is turned.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.PrintSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the that provides access to all printing functionality.
member.value: The that provides access to all printing functionality.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.ScrollBarAccelerationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the TimeSpan that indicates the amount of time it takes to increase the number of ScrollBar units scrolled per small change during ScrollBar acceleration.
member.value: A TimeSpan indicating the interval. The default value is 3 seconds.
member.remarks:
ScrollBar acceleration kicks in when holding down one of the ScrollBar controls' small change buttons. At each interval specified by , the number of units scrolled with each small change increases by 1 until is reached. This enables you to more quickly scroll large distances through documents.
For example, with the default settings, holding the vertical ScrollBar's down button will start scrolling down 1 line at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 2 lines at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 3 lines at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 4 lines at a time and will no longer increase the lines scrolled per small change. Once the down button is released, everything resets back and acceleration is available for the next scroll operation.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.ScrollBarAccelerationMaximum
member.summary: Gets or sets a value between 1 and 10 that indicates the maximum number of ScrollBar units that are scrolled during peak ScrollBar acceleration.
member.value: A value between 1 and 10 indicating the maximum number of units. Set to 1, the minimum, to disable acceleration. The default value is 4.
member.remarks:
ScrollBar acceleration kicks in when holding down one of the ScrollBar controls' small change buttons. At each interval specified by , the number of units scrolled with each small change increases by 1 until is reached. This enables you to more quickly scroll large distances through documents.
For example, with the default settings, holding the vertical ScrollBar's down button will start scrolling down 1 line at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 2 lines at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 3 lines at a time. 3 seconds later, it will increase to 4 lines at a time and will no longer increase the lines scrolled per small change. Once the down button is released, everything resets back and acceleration is available for the next scroll operation.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.ScrollToCaretOnSelectAll
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to scroll to the caret when selecting all text in a view.
member.value: true if a view should scroll to the caret when selecting all its text; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.SelectionCollapsesOnCopy
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the selection collapses when a copy operation occurs.
member.value: true if the selection collapses when a copy operation occurs; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.SelectionCollapsesToAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the selection collapses to the anchor of the selection.
member.value: true if the selection collapses to the anchor of the selection; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.value: A value indicating the selection modes that are allowed within the editor. The default value is Block and ContinuousStream.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SyntaxEditor.WordWrapMode

member.value: A value indicating the type of word wrapping that is performed. The default value is WordWrapMode.None.

member.summary: Gets or sets the to animate the scale from one zoom level to the next.
member.value: The to animate the scale from one zoom level to the next. The default value is 300ms.
member.remarks: Set to 0ms or Duration.Automatic to disable zoom animation.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies a type of location to algorithm.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm.BestFit
member.summary: If the location is over the left half of a character, the character's position is returned. If the location is over the right half of a character, the next character's position is returned. If the location is past the last character in a line and virtual space past the end of lines is disabled, the position of the last character in the line is returned. If the location is past the end of a document and virtual space past the end of the document is disabled, the position of the last character in the document is returned.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm.Block
member.summary: If the location is over a character, the character's offset is returned. If the location is past the last character in a line and virtual space past the end of lines is disabled, the position of the last character in the line is returned. If the location is past the end of a document and virtual space past the end of the document is disabled, the position of the last character in the document is returned.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.LocationToPositionAlgorithm.Absolute
member.summary: If the location is over a character, the character's position is returned. Otherwise, -1 is returned.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SelectionModes
member.summary: Specifies the types of selection.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SelectionModes.None
member.summary: No selection is permitted. This value should only be used setting the allowed selection modes and not for setting a specific selection mode on the object.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SelectionModes.ContinuousStream
member.summary: Selection proceeds in a continuous, linear stream from the start of the selection to the end, as in a standard edit control. Entire lines are selected when you move to the next or previous line. This is the default selection mode.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.SelectionModes.Block
member.summary: Only a rectangular portion of text is selected instead of the whole line. The selection includes all of the characters captured within the rectangle defined by the first (anchor) character and the last character in the selection.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.WordWrapMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode of word wrapping to perform.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.WordWrapMode.None
member.summary: Do not perform any word wrapping.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.SyntaxEditor.WordWrapMode.Word
member.summary: Perform word-boundary-based word wrap.
